definitions.definition: Yes, that is correct ; I agree .
examples: — United's the best team in the country. — Right . And they'll go all the way for sure. — Damn right they will.

definitions.definition: I have listened to what you just said and I acknowledge your assertion or opinion, regardless of whether I agree with it (opinion) or can verify it (assertion).
examples: — United's the best team in the country, so they'll come up with something. — Right . And do you think they'll go all the way?

definitions.definition: Signpost word to change the subject in a discussion or discourse .
examples: — After that interview, I don't think we should hire her. — Right . Who wants lunch?

definitions.definition: Used to check listener engagement and (especially) agreement at the end of an utterance or each segment thereof .
examples: I went downstairs, right , and I was going to call her, but I found this note, right , so what am I supposed to do now?

definitions.definition: Used to add seriousness or decisiveness before a statement.
